name: Check Suspicious Links via Telegram with GPT-4 Analysis of VirusTotal & urlscan.io Results

user.name: Michael Gullo
user.bio: I‚Äôm passionate about using  n8n to create realistic workflows that help working class people simplify their daily tasks. My workflows aim to make life easier by eliminating mundane, repetitive responsibilities that take up valuable time. I love turning automation into a tool that lets people focus on what matters most to them.

description:
# **Workflow Purpose**
The workflow is designed to scan submitted URLs using urlscan.io and VirusTotal, combine the results into a single structured summary, and send the report via Telegram.

I built this workflow for people who primarily work from their phones and receive a constant stream of emails throughout the day. If a user gets an email asking them to sign a document, review a report, or take any action where the link looks suspicious, they can simply open the Telegram bot and quickly check whether the URL is safe before clicking it.

## Key Components
**1. Input / Trigger**
- Accepts URLs that need to be checked.
- Initiates requests to VirusTotal and urlscan.io.

**2. VirusTotal Scan**
- Always returns results if the URL is reachable.
- Provides reputation, malicious/clean flags, and scan metadata.

**3. urlscan.io Scan**
- Returns details on how the URL behaves when loaded (domains, requests, resources, etc.).
- Sometimes fails due to blocks or restrictions.

**4. Error Handling with Code Node**
- Checks whether urlscan.io responded successfully.
- Ensures the workflow always produces a summary, even if urlscan.io fails.

**5. Summary Generation**
- If both scans succeed ‚Üí summarize combined findings from VirusTotal + urlscan.io.
- If urlscan.io fails ‚Üí state clearly in the summary ‚Äúurlscan.io scan was blocked/failed. Relying on VirusTotal results.‚Äù
- Ensures user still gets a complete security report.

**6. Telegram Output**
- Final formatted summary is delivered to a Telegram chat via the bot.
- Chat ID issue was fixed after the Code Node restructuring.

### Outcome
- The workflow now guarantees a consistent, user-friendly summary regardless of urlscan.io failures.
- It leverages VirusTotal as the fallback source of truth.
- The Telegram bot provides real-time alerts with clear indications of scan success/failure.


#### Prequisites
**Telegram**
- In Telegram, start a chat with @BotFather.
- Send /newbot, pick a name and a unique username.
- Copy the HTTP API token BotFather returns (store securely)
- Start a DM with your bot and send any message.
- Call getUpdates and read the chat.id

**urlscan.io**
- Create/log into your urlscan.io account.
- Go to Settings & API ‚Üí New API key and generate a key.
- (Recommended) In Settings & API, set Default Scan Visibility to Unlisted to avoid exposing PII in public scans.
- Save the key securely (env var or n8n Credentials).
- Rate limits note: urlscan.io enforces per-minute/hour/day quotas; exceeding them returns HTTP 429. You can view your personal quotas on their dashboard/quotas endpoint

**Virustotal**
- Sign up / sign in to VirusTotal Community.
- Open My API key (Profile menu) and copy your Public API key.
- Store it securely (env var or n8n Credentials).
- For a more reliable connection with VirusTotal and improved scanning results, enable the Header section in the node settings. Add a header parameter with a clear name (e.g., x-apikey), and then paste your API key into the Value field.
- Rate limits (Public API): 4 requests/minute, 500/day; not for commercial workflows. Consider Premium if you‚Äôll exceed this.

##### How to Customize the Workflow
This workflow is designed to be highly customizable, allowing users to adapt it to their specific needs and use cases. For example, additional malicious website scanners can be integrated through HTTP Request nodes. To make this work, the user simply needs to update the Merge node so that all information flows correctly through the workflow.

In addition, users can connect either Gmail or Outlook nodes to automatically test URLs, binary attachments, and other types of information received via email‚Äîhelping them evaluate data before opening it.

Users can also customize how they receive reports. For instance, results can be sent through Telegram (as in the default setup), Slack, Microsoft Teams, or even saved to Google Drive or a Google Sheet for recordkeeping and audit purposes. 

For consulting and support, or if you have questions, please feel free to connect with me on [Linkedin](www.linkedin.com/in/michael-gullo-46b3b7274) or [via email](michael.gullo@outlook.com).

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

parameters.content:
Goal:
This workflow allows users to quickly analyze potentially malicious URLs received via text or email, directly from their mobile device using Telegram.
When users don't have time to manually investigate links on a computer or search engine, they can simply paste the URL into the Telegram chat and receive a concise summary of the scan results‚Äîpowered by two open-source URL scanning services.

Disclaimer:
While this tool helps identify threats, it does not guarantee full protection. Use caution‚ÄîTelegram itself could be a potential point of compromise. Always follow safe browsing practices.

Workflow Nodes:
Telegram Trigger ‚Äì Listens for incoming messages with URLs.

urlscan.io ‚Äì Performs the first malicious URL scan.

VirusTotal (HTTP Request) ‚Äì Executes a second URL scan using VirusTotal.

Merge Node ‚Äì Combines the results from both scanners.

AI Agent (ChatGPT with simple memory) ‚Äì Analyzes the scan results and generates a readable summary.

Limit Node ‚Äì Ensures only one summary is sent per URL.

Telegram Send Message Node ‚Äì Sends the summary back to the user.

Google Sheets (Logging) ‚Äì Records scan results for auditing or historical reference.

parameters.text:
=Role:
You are a cybersecurity assistant specializing in analyzing and summarizing URL scan reports. Use results from VirusTotal (always available) and urlscan.io (only if successful) to provide a professional, clear, and easy-to-understand summary.

Instructions ‚Äì Follow These Steps (Do Not Include in Final Summary):

1.	Identify the scanned URL:
{{ $('Telegram Trigger').item.json.message.text }}

2. Check urlscan.io status (already provided by Code node):
‚¶Å	If urlscan_status is "success" ‚Üí include findings from urlscan_data alongside VirusTotal.
‚¶Å	If urlscan_status is "failed" ‚Üí rely only on VirusTotal and clearly state: ‚Äúurlscan.io scan failed or was blocked.‚Äù

3. Assess threat level (based on VirusTotal):
Classify as Harmless, Suspicious, or Malicious
‚¶Å	Base this on:
‚¶Å	The number of engines that flagged the URL
‚¶Å	Severity of detections from notable vendors (Kaspersky, Bitdefender, Sophos, etc.)

4. Quantify detections:
‚¶Å	Number of VirusTotal engines flagging the URL
‚¶Å	Notable antivirus vendors and what they reported

Provide recommendation:
‚¶Å	Use plain, clear language for a general audience
‚¶Å	Examples: ‚ÄúAppears safe,‚Äù ‚ÄúProceed with caution,‚Äù ‚ÄúAvoid this URL.‚Äù


Output Format:
Title:
Summary for {{ $('Telegram Trigger').item.json.message.text }} {{ $now }}

Bullet Points:
‚¶Å	Threat Level: [Harmless / Suspicious / Malicious]
‚¶Å	Number of engines flagging the URL: [X engines]
‚¶Å	VirusTotal score: [Number or descriptive result]

urlscan.io indicators:
‚¶Å	If urlscan_status is "success" ‚Üí summarize results from urlscan_data
‚¶Å	If urlscan_status is "failed" ‚Üí output exactly: ‚ÄúScan failed or was blocked‚Äù

‚¶Å	Notable detections: [List key AV engines if any]
‚¶Å	Recommendation: [Plain-language recommendation]

Final Summary (4‚Äì8 sentences):
‚¶Å	Always provide a complete summary.
‚¶Å	If urlscan.io succeeded ‚Üí combine VirusTotal + urlscan.io results.
‚¶Å	If urlscan.io failed ‚Üí summarize VirusTotal results normally, then add one sentence noting the urlscan.io scan was blocked or failed.
‚¶Å	Include: the URL, detection counts, notable antivirus vendors, and a clear recommendation.

Close with this reminder:
Even if a link appears safe, always exercise caution when clicking unknown URLs‚Äîthreats can evolve quickly.

options.systemMessage:
You are a cybersecurity assistant designed to analyze and summarize URL scan results using data from VirusTotal and urlscan.io.

Your role is to:

Provide a concise, professional, and easy-to-understand summary of each scan.

Extract key insights from the JSON responses of both services.

Normalize and interpret data to assess whether the scanned URL is harmless, suspicious, or malicious.

Write in a tone that is accessible to users with basic technical literacy.

Avoid raw JSON fields, API parameter names, or unnecessary technical jargon.

For each scan, your output should include:

A bullet-point summary of the key findings.

A short written summary (4‚Äì8 sentences) combining insights from both sources.

A clear recommendation to help the user decide whether to avoid, review, or safely access the URL.

Always integrate results from both services into a unified, user-friendly report.
